coranāga：coranāga（pu）
စောရနာဂ（ပု）
[cora+nāga]
[စောရ+နာဂ]

Coranāga：King of Ceylon （3 B.C.-9 A.C.）．He was the son of Vattagāmani and his name was Mahānāga （Mhv.xxxiii.45）．During the reign of Mahācūli Mahātissa he was a rebel and came to the throne after Mahācūli’s death．He destroyed eighteen vihāras which had refused to shelter him as a rebel．He was poisoned by his queen Anulā （Mhv.xxxiv.11ff）．It is said （MA.ii.920； DA.ii.433； AA.ii.532） that after death he was born in the Lokantarikaniraya with a body three gāvutas in height.

coranāga：စောရနာဂ （ပု）
[စောရ+နာဂ]
（၁） နာဂမည်သောခိုးသူ၊ ခိုးသူနာဂ။ （၂） စောရနာဂမင်း။
